intro: Corydalis handel-mazzettii, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are usually slender and branching. Corydalis handel-mazzettii is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
